meanings.definition: To be very bad or unpleasant.
meanings.sent3: It sucks when you forget your umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent4: Failing the test really sucks the joy out of the day.
meanings.sent5: The smell of rotten eggs sucks all the enjoyment out of the room.

meanings.definition: To draw in or pull with force.
meanings.sent1: The vacuum cleaner sucks up all the dirt from the carpet.
meanings.sent2: The straw sucks up the juice from the cup.
meanings.sent3: The black hole sucks in everything around it.
meanings.sent4: The tornado sucks up debris and leaves a path of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The powerful magnet sucks the metal objects towards it.

meanings.sent1: This old phone really sucks compared to the new one.
meanings.sent2: The substitute teacher sucks at explaining math.
meanings.sent3: My attempt at baking a cake from scratch really sucks.
meanings.sent4: The cheap glue sucks at holding things together.
meanings.sent5: The old car sucks in terms of fuel efficiency.
